subject: WRS
name: Aquat. Field Meth
fullname: Introduction to Field Research in Water Resources
info: Introduction to field research techniques and opportunities during two-week summer excursion to regional sites. Data acquisition in large/small lakes, streams, and wetlands for biota and chemical/physical water quality; surface and groundwater hydrologic measurements and sampling.

subject: WRS
name: Topics Water Resources Science
fullname: Special Topics in Water Resources Science
info: Practical topics for local water resource management. Policy and institutions, watershed science, civic engagement, assessment, communication, implementation practices, and administration. Requires working with a mentor in local water resource management. Online only.

subject: WRS
name: Water Policy
info: Socio-cultural, legal, and economic forces that affect water resource use. Water quality, Clean Water Act contrasted with international laws, roles of State and Local agencies. Water supply, drought, flooding, drainage, irrigation, storage. Sulfide mining, Line 3, hypoxia, wildfire, climate, snowpack, extreme events, China south-to-north transfer, CECâ€™s, AIS, Aral Sea, CAFOs, and more.

subject: WRS
name: Watershed Specialist Training
info: Practical topics for water resource management professionals. Current policies and institutions, watershed science, civic engagement, assessment, communication, implementation practices, and administration. Requires working with a mentor in local water resource management. Online only.

subject: WRS
name: Ecological Risk Assessment
info: Evaluating current/potential impact of physical, chemical, and biological agents on ecosystems. Identifying ecological stressors, assessing level of exposure, measuring ecological responses, communicating/managing risks.  Class participation, two reaction papers, final exam, small-group project.prereq: instr consent

subject: WRS
name: Special Topics
fullname: Special Topics in Water Resources Science
info: Special topics in water resources science.

subject: WRS
name: Directed Study
fullname: Directed Studies in Water Resources Science
info: Directed studies in water resources science.prereq: instr consent

subject: WRS
name: Plan B Project
info: Optional course for M.S. Plan B students. Can be taken once for up to 3 credits, and may count towards credit minimum.

subject: WRS
name: FTE: Master's
info: (No description)prereq: Master's student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: WRS
name: FTE: Doctoral
info: (No description)prereq: Doctoral student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: WRS
name: Research Ethics, Env & Water
fullname: Research and Professional Ethics in Water Resources and Environmental Science
info: Ethics of water resources science and environmental engineering research/practice. Societal responsibility, plagiarism, recording-keeping, authorship, confidentiality, conflicts of interest, professional relationships, fraud, reporting misconduct. Meets during first eight weeks of spring semester.prereq: [Environmental engineering or water resources science] grad student or instr consent

subject: WRS
name: Doct Pre-Thesis Cr
info: TBDprereq: Doctoral student who has not passed prelim oral; no required consent for 1st/2nd registrations, up to 12 combined cr; dept consent for 3rd/4th registrations, up to 24 combined cr; doctoral student admitted before summer 2007 may register up to four times, up to 60 combined cr

subject: WRS
name: Thesis Credit:Mast*
info: (No description)prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 10 cr total required [Plan A only]
